6) the 1st letter of the Roman alphabet
7) the blood group whose red cells carry the A antigen

aa.definition: a dry form of lava resembling clinkers

aachen.definition: a city in western Germany near the Dutch and Belgian borders; formerly it was Charlemagne's northern capital

aalborg.definition: a city and port in northern Jutland

aalii.definition: a small Hawaiian tree with hard dark wood

aalto.definition: Finnish architect and designer of furniture (1898-1976)

aardvark.definition: nocturnal burrowing mammal of the grasslands of Africa that feeds on termites; sole extant representative of the order Tubulidentata

aaron.definition:
1) United States professional baseball player who hit more home runs than Babe Ruth (born in 1934)
2) (Old Testament) elder brother of Moses and first high priest of the Israelites; created the golden calf

synonyms: Association for the advancement of retired persons

ab.definition:
2) the eleventh month of the civil year; the fifth month of the ecclesiastical year in the Jewish calendar (in July and August)
4) the blood group whose red cells carry both the A and B antigens

aba.definition:
1) a loose sleeveless outer garment made from aba cloth; worn by Arabs
2) a fabric woven from goat hair and camel hair

abaca.definition: Philippine banana tree having leafstalks that yield Manila hemp used for rope and paper etc

abacinate.definition: blind by holding a red-hot metal plate before someone's eyes

examples.en: The prisoners were abacinated by their captors

aback.definition:
1) having the wind against the forward side of the sails
2) by surprise

examples.en: the ship came up into the wind with all yards aback
taken aback by the caustic remarks

abacus.definition:
1) a tablet placed horizontally on top of the capital of a column as an aid in supporting the architrave

abampere.definition: a unit of current equal to 10 amperes

abandon.definition:
1) forsake, leave behind
2) give up with the intent of never claiming again
4) stop maintaining or insisting on; of ideas or claims

examples.en: We abandoned the old car in the empty parking lot
She gave up her children to her ex-husband when she moved to Tahiti

Both sides have to give up some claims in these negotiations

abandoned.definition:
1) forsaken by owner or inhabitants
2) free from constraint

examples.en: weed-grown yard of an abandoned farmhouse
an abandoned sadness born of grief"- Liam O'Flaherty

abandonment.definition:
1) the act of giving something up
3) the voluntary surrender of property (or a right to property) without attempting to reclaim it or give it away

examples.en: each confession brought her into an attitude of abasement"- H.L.Menchken

abashed.definition: feeling or caused to feel uneasy and self-conscious

examples.en: felt abashed at the extravagant praise
chagrined at the poor sales of his book

abasic.definition: of or relating to abasia (inability to walk)

abate.definition: become less in amount or intensity

examples.en: The rain let up after a few hours

abator.definition: a person who abates a nuisance

abattis.definition: a line of defense consisting of a barrier of felled or live trees with branches (sharpened or with barbed wire entwined) pointed toward the enemy

abattoir.definition: a building where animals are butchered

abaxial.definition: facing away from the axis of an organ or organism

examples.en: the abaxial surface of a leaf is the underside or side facing away from the stem

abbacy.definition: the jurisdiction or office of an abbot

abbatial.definition: of or having to do with or belonging to an abbey or abbot, or abbess

abbey.definition:
1) a church associated with a monastery or convent
2) a convent ruled by an abbess
3) a monastery ruled by an abbot

abbess.definition: the superior of a group of nuns

abbot.definition: the superior of an abbey of monks

abbreviated.definition:
1) (of clothing) very short
2) cut short in duration

examples.en: her shortened life was clearly the result of smoking

abbreviation.definition:
1) a shortened form of a word or phrase
2) shortening something by omitting parts of it

abcoulomb.definition: a unit of electrical charge equal to 10 coulombs

abdicable.definition: capable of being discarded or renounced or relinquished

abdicate.definition: give up, such as power, as of monarchs and emperors, or duties and obligations

examples.en: The King abdicated when he married a divorcee

abdication.definition:
1) a formal resignation and renunciation of powers
2) the act of abdicating

abdicator.definition: one who formally relinquishes an office or responsibility

abdomen.definition: the region of the body of a vertebrate between the thorax and the pelvis

abdominal.definition: of or relating to or near the abdomen

abdominocentesis.definition: centesis of the belly to remove fluid for diagnosis

abdominovesical.definition: of or relating to the abdomen and the urinary bladder

abducent.definition: especially of muscles; drawing away from the midline of the body or from an adjacent part

abduction.definition:
1) the criminal act of capturing and carrying away by force a family member; if a man's wife is abducted it is a crime against the family relationship and against the wife
2) (physiology) moving of a body part away from the central axis of the body

abductor.definition: a muscle that draws a body part away from the median line

abeam.definition: at right angles to the length of a ship or airplane

abecedarian.definition:
1) alphabetically arranged (as for beginning readers)
2) a 16th century sect of Anabaptists centered in Germany who had an absolute disdain for human knowledge

abecedarius.definition: a poem having lines beginning with letters of the alphabet in regular order

abeyant.definition: inactive but capable of becoming active

abel.definition:
1) Norwegian mathematician (1802-1829)

abelard.definition: French philosopher and theologian; lover of Heloise (1079-1142)

abelia.definition: any of various deciduous or evergreen ornamental shrubs of the genus Abelia having opposite simple leaves and cymes of small white or pink or purplish flowers; Asia and Mexico

abelmoschus.definition: genus of tropical coarse herbs having large lobed leaves and often yellow flowers

abelmosk.definition: bushy herb of tropical Asia grown for its yellow or pink to scarlet blooms that resemble the hibiscus

aberdare.definition: a mining town in southern Wales

aberdeen.definition:
1) a town in western Washington
2) a town in northeastern South Dakota
3) a town in northeastern Maryland

aberrance.definition: a state or condition markedly different from the norm

aberrant.definition: markedly different from an accepted norm

aberrate.definition:
1) diverge from the expected
2) diverge or deviate from the straight path; produce aberration

examples.en: The President aberrated from being a perfect gentleman
The surfaces of the concave lens may be proportioned so as to aberrate exactly equal to the convex lens

aberration.definition:
2) a disorder in one's mental state
3) an optical phenomenon resulting from the failure of a lens or mirror to produce a good image

abet.definition: assist or encourage, usually in some wrongdoing

abetment.definition: the verbal act of urging on

abettor.definition: one who helps or encourages or incites another

abfarad.definition: a capacitance unit equal to one billion farads

abhenry.definition: a unit of inductance equal to one billionth of a henry

abhorrer.definition: a signer of a 1679 address to Charles II in which those who petitioned for the reconvening of parliament were condemned and abhorred

abidance.definition: the act of abiding (enduring without yielding)

abidjan.definition: city recognized by the United States as the capital of the Ivory Coast; largest city of the Ivory Coast

abydos.definition: an ancient Greek colony on the Asiatic side of the Dardanelles; scene of the legend of Hero and Leander

abilene.definition:
1) a city in central Texas
2) a town in central Kansas to the west of Topeka; home of Dwight D. Eisenhower

ability.definition:
1) the quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment
2) possession of the qualities (especially mental qualities) required to do something or get something done

abiogenesis.definition: a hypothetical organic phenomenon by which living organisms are created from nonliving matter

abiotrophy.definition: a loss of vitality and a degeneration of cells and tissues not due to any apparent injury

abysmal.definition:
1) very great; limitless
2) resembling an abyss in depth; so deep as to be unmeasurable

examples.en: the abyssal depths of the ocean

abyssinian.definition: a small slender short-haired breed of African origin having brownish fur with a reddish undercoat

abject.definition:
1) of the most contemptible kind
2) most unfortunate or miserable
3) showing utter resignation or hopelessness

abjure.definition: formally reject or disavow a formerly held belief, usually under pressure

examples.en: He retracted his earlier statements about his religion

abkhaz.definition:
1) of or relating to Abkazia or its people or their language

3) Circassian people living east of the Black Sea

abkhazian.definition: a Circassian language spoken by the Abkhaz

ablate.definition:
1) wear away through erosion or vaporization

ablated.definition: made smaller or less by melting or erosion or vaporization

ablation.definition:
1) surgical removal of a body part or tissue
2) the erosive process that reduces the size of glaciers

ablative.definition:
1) relating to the ablative case

examples.en: ablative material on a rocket cone

ablaut.definition: a vowel whose quality or length is changed to indicate linguistic distinctions (such as sing sang sung song)

ablaze.definition:
1) keenly excited (especially sexually) or indicating excitement

examples.en: his face all ablaze with excitement"- Bram Stoker
forests set ablaze (or afire) by lightning
even the car's tires were aflame

able.definition:
1) (usually followed by `to') having the necessary means or skill or know-how or authority to do something
2) have the skills and qualifications to do things well
3) having inherent physical or mental ability or capacity

examples.en: she was able to program her computer
human beings are able to walk on two feet

ablution.definition: the ritual washing of a priest's hands or of sacred vessels

abnaki.definition:
1) of or relating to the Abnakis or their language
2) the Algonquian language spoken by the Abnaki and Penobscot

abnegate.definition:
2) surrender (power or a position)
3) deny or renounce

examples.en: The King abnegated his power to the ministers

abnegation.definition:
1) the denial and rejection of a doctrine or belief
2) renunciation of your own interests in favor of the interests of others

abnegator.definition: one who gives up or relinquishes or renounces something

abnormal.definition:
1) not normal; not typical or usual or regular or conforming to a norm
2) departing from the normal in e.g. intelligence and development
3) much greater than the normal

examples.en: they were heartbroken when they learned their child was abnormal

1) an abnormal physical condition resulting from defective genes or developmental deficiencies
2) retardation sufficient to fall outside the normal range of intelligence
3) marked strangeness as a consequence of being abnormal

examples.en: his blood pressure was abnormally low

aboard.definition:
1) on a ship, train, plane or other vehicle
2) on first or second or third base
3) side by side

examples.en: Their second homer with Bob Allison aboard

abohm.definition: a unit of resistance equal to a billionth of an ohm

examples.en: Slavery was abolished in the mid-19th century in America and in Russia

abolition.definition: the act of abolishing a system or practice or institution (especially abolishing slavery)

abolitionary.definition: relating to or favoring abolition, especially abolition of slavery

abolitionism.definition: the doctrine that calls for the abolition of slavery

abolitionist.definition: a reformer who favors abolishing slavery

abomasal.definition: relating to the abomasum (the fourth compartment of the stomach of ruminants)

abomasum.definition: the fourth compartment of the stomach of a ruminant; the one where digestion takes place

abomination.definition:
1) a person who is loathsome or disgusting
3) an action that is vicious or vile; an action that arouses disgust or abhorrence

examples.en: his treatment of the children is an abomination

aborad.definition: away from the mouth or oral region

aboral.definition: opposite to or away from the mouth

aboriginal.definition:
1) of or pertaining to members of the indigenous people of Australia
3) having existed from the beginning; in an earliest or original stage or state

examples.en: primal eras before the appearance of life on earth

aborigine.definition: a dark-skinned member of a race of people living in Australia when Europeans arrived

abort.definition:
1) terminate before completion
2) cease development, die, and be aborted

abortive.definition: failing to accomplish an intended result

abortus.definition: a human fetus whose weight is less than 0.5 kilogram when removed or expelled from the mother's body

abound.definition:

about.definition:
1) on the move
2) all around or on all sides
3) in the area or vicinity

1) turn, usually 180 degrees
2) change one's mind and assume the opposite viewpoint

above.definition:
1) at an earlier place
2) in or to a place that is higher

straightforward in all his business affairs

abrachia.definition: the condition of having no arms

abrader.definition: a tool or machine used for wearing down or smoothing or polishing

abraham.definition: the first of the Old Testament patriarchs and the father of Isaac; according to Genesis, God promised to give Abraham's family (the Hebrews) the land of Canaan (the Promised Land); God tested Abraham by asking him to sacrifice his son

examples.en: Judaism, Christianity, and Islam each has a special claim on Abraham

abrasion.definition:
1) an abraded area where the skin is torn or worn off
2) erosion by friction

abrasiveness.definition: the quality of being sharply disagreeable

abreast.definition: alongside each other, facing in the same direction

abridge.definition:

abridged.definition: (used of texts) shortened by condensing or rewriting

abroad.definition: to or in a foreign country

abrocome.definition: ratlike rodent with soft fur and large ears of the Andes

abrogation.definition: the act of abrogating; an official or legal cancellation

abronia.definition: genus of western North American herbs having showy flowers

abrupt.definition:
1) marked by sudden changes in subject and sharp transitions
2) exceedingly sudden and unexpected

the precipitous rapids of the upper river

abruptness.definition:
1) an abrupt discourteous manner

3) the quality of happening with headlong haste or without warning

abscess.definition: symptom consisting of a localized collection of pus surrounded by inflamed tissue

abscise.definition:
1) shed flowers and leaves and fruit following formation of a scar tissue

1) shedding of flowers and leaves and fruit following formation of scar tissue in a plant

abscond.definition: run away; usually includes taking something or somebody along

examples.en: The thief made off with our silver
the accountant absconded with the cash from the safe

absence.definition:
1) the state of being absent
2) failure to be present
3) the time interval during which something or somebody is away

examples.en: he was surprised by the absence of any explanation

absent.definition:
1) not being in a specified place
3) lost in thought; showing preoccupation

absentee.definition: one that is absent or not in residence

absently.definition: in an absentminded or preoccupied manner

absinth.definition: strong green liqueur flavored with wormwood and anise

absolute.definition:
1) perfect or complete or pure
2) complete and without restriction or qualification; sometimes used informally as intensifiers
3) not limited by law

absolutely.definition:
1) completely and without qualification; used informally as intensifiers
2) totally and definitely; without question

examples.en: we are absolutely opposed to the idea
he forced himself to lie absolutely still

1) the condition of being formally forgiven by a priest in the sacrament of penance
2) the act of absolving or remitting; formal redemption as pronounced by a priest in the sacrament of penance

absolved.definition: freed from any question of guilt

absorb.definition:
1) become imbued
2) take up mentally
3) take up, as of debts or payments

examples.en: The liquids, light, and gases absorb

absorbable.definition: capable of being absorbed or taken in through the pores of a surface

absorbent.definition: having power or capacity or tendency to absorb or soak up something (liquids or energy etc.)

absorber.definition: (physics) material in a nuclear reactor that absorbs radiation

absorbing.definition: capable of arousing and holding the attention

absorption.definition:
1) (chemistry) a process in which one substance permeates another; a fluid permeates or is dissolved by a liquid or solid
2) (physics) the process in which incident radiated energy is retained without reflection or transmission on passing through a medium

examples.en: the absorption of photons by atoms or molecules

abstain.definition:
1) refrain from voting
2) choose not to consume

abstainer.definition:
1) someone who practices self denial as a spiritual discipline

abstemious.definition:
1) sparing in consumption of especially food and drink
2) marked by temperance in indulgence

examples.en: the pleasures of the table, never of much consequence to one naturally abstemious"- John Galsworthy
abstemious with the use of adverbs

abstemiously.definition: in a sparing manner; without overindulgence

abstemiousness.definition:
1) restricted to bare necessities
2) moderation in eating and drinking

abstinence.definition:
1) the trait of abstaining (especially from alcohol)
2) act or practice of refraining from indulging an appetite

abstract.definition:
1) existing only in the mind; separated from embodiment
2) not representing or imitating external reality or the objects of nature
3) dealing with a subject in the abstract without practical purpose or intention

abstractedness.definition: preoccupation with something to the exclusion of all else

abstraction.definition:
1) a concept or idea not associated with any specific instance
2) the act of withdrawing or removing something
3) the process of formulating general concepts by abstracting common properties of instances

examples.en: he loved her only in the abstract--not in person

abstractionism.definition:
1) an abstract genre of art; artistic content depends on internal form rather than pictorial representation
2) a representation having no reference to concrete objects or specific examples

abstractive.definition: of an abstracting nature or having the power of abstracting

abstractness.definition: the quality of being considered apart from a specific instance or object

abstractor.definition: one who makes abstracts or summarizes information

abstruse.definition: difficult to penetrate; incomprehensible to one of ordinary understanding or knowledge

examples.en: the professor's lectures were so abstruse that students tended to avoid them

abstrusely.definition: in a manner difficult to understand

examples.en: the professor's abstrusely reasoned theories were wasted on his students

absurd.definition:
1) inconsistent with reason or logic or common sense
2) incongruous; inviting ridicule

examples.en: the absurd predicament of seeming to argue that virtue is highly desirable but intensely unpleasant"- Walter Lippman
the absurd excuse that the dog ate his homework

absurdity.definition:
1) a message whose content is at variance with reason
2) a ludicrous folly

examples.en: the crowd laughed at the absurdity of the clown's behavior

absurdly.definition: in an absurd manner or to an absurd degree

abukir.definition: a bay on the Mediterranean Sea in northern Egypt

abulic.definition: suffering from abulia; showing abnormal inability to act or make decisions

abundance.definition:
1) the property of a more than adequate quantity or supply
2) (physics) the ratio of the number of atoms of a specific isotope of an element to the total number of isotopes present
3) (chemistry) the ratio of the total mass of an element in the earth's crust to the total mass of the earth's crust; expressed as a percentage or in parts per million

examples.en: they were abundantly supplied with food

abuse.definition:
2) a rude expression intended to offend or hurt
3) use foul or abusive language towards
4) use wrongly or improperly or excessively

examples.en: when a student made a stupid mistake he spared them no abuse
they yelled insults at the visiting team
The actress abused the policeman who gave her a parking ticket
The angry mother shouted at the teacher
while she was pregnant, she abused drugs

abused.definition:
1) used improperly or excessively especially drugs
2) subjected to cruel treatment

abusive.definition:
1) expressing offensive reproach
2) characterized by physical or psychological maltreatment

examples.en: he behaved abusively toward his children

abutilon.definition: herbs or shrubs or small trees: flowering maple; Indian mallow

abutment.definition:
1) point of contact between two objects or parts
2) a masonry support that touches and directly receives thrust or pressure of an arch or bridge

abuzz.definition: noisy like the sound of a bee

examples.en: the room was abuzz over the latest scandal

abvolt.definition: a unit of potential equal to one-hundred-millionth of a volt

abwatt.definition: a power unit equal to the power dissipated when 1 abampere flows across a potential difference of 1 abvolt (one ten-thousandth of a milliwatt)

acacia.definition: any of various spiny trees or shrubs of the genus Acacia

academy.definition:
1) a secondary school (usually private)
2) an institution for the advancement of art or science or literature
3) a school for special training

academic.definition:
1) associated with academia or an academy
2) hypothetical or theoretical and not expected to produce an immediate or practical result
3) marked by a narrow focus on or display of learning especially its trivial aspects

examples.en: academically, this is a good school

academician.definition:
1) someone elected to honorary membership in an academy
2) a scholar who is skilled in academic disputation
3) an educator who works at a college or university

academicianship.definition: the position of member of an honorary academy

acadia.definition: the French-speaking part of the Canadian Maritime Provinces

acadian.definition: an early French settler in the Maritimes

acalypha.definition: a genus of herbs and shrubs belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae

acanthaceae.definition: widely distributed herbs and shrubs and trees; sometimes placed in the order Scrophulariales

acanthion.definition: the craniometric point at the anterior extremity of the intermaxillary suture

acanthocephala.definition: phylum or class of elongated wormlike parasites that live in the intestines of vertebrates: spiny-headed worms

acanthocephalan.definition: any of various worms living parasitically in intestines of vertebrates having a retractile proboscis covered with many hooked spines

acanthocereus.definition: mostly trailing cacti having nocturnal white flowers; tropical America and Caribbean region

acanthoid.definition: shaped like a spine or thorn

acantholysis.definition: a breakdown of a cell layer in the epidermis (as in pemphigus)

acanthoma.definition: a neoplasm originating in the epidermis

acanthopterygii.definition: teleost fishes having fins with sharp bony rays

acanthosis.definition: an abnormal but benign thickening of the prickle-cell layer of the skin (as in psoriasis)

acanthotic.definition: of or relating to or having acanthosis

acanthurus.definition: type genus of the Acanthuridae: doctorfishes

acanthus.definition: any plant of the genus Acanthus having large spiny leaves and spikes or white or purplish flowers; native to Mediterranean region but widely cultivated

acapulco.definition: a port and fashionable resort city on the Pacific coast of southern Mexico; known for beaches and water sports (including cliff diving)

acardia.definition: congenital absence of the heart (as in the development of some monsters)

acaricide.definition: a chemical agent used to kill mites

acarid.definition: very small free-living arachnid that is parasitic on animals or plants; related to ticks

acarophobia.definition: a morbid fear of small insects and mites and worms

acarus.definition: any of several mites of the order Acarina

acatalectic.definition: (verse) metrically complete; especially having the full number of syllables in the final metrical foot

acataphasia.definition: a disorder in which a lesion to the central nervous system leaves you unable to formulate a statement or to express yourself in an organized manner

acaudate.definition: lacking a tail or taillike appendage

acaulescent.definition: (of plants) having no apparent stem above ground

accelerate.definition:
1) move faster
2) cause to move faster

accelerated.definition: speeded up, as of an academic course

examples.en: in an accelerated program in school

acceleration.definition:
1) an increase in rate of change
2) the act of accelerating; increasing the speed
3) (physics) a rate of increase of velocity

examples.en: modern science caused an acceleration of cultural change

accelerator.definition:
1) a pedal that controls the throttle valve
2) a valve that regulates the supply of fuel to the engine
4) a scientific instrument that increases the kinetic energy of charged particles

accelerometer.definition: an instrument for measuring the acceleration of aircraft or rockets

accent.definition:
1) distinctive manner of oral expression
5) a diacritical mark used to indicate stress or placed above a vowel to indicate a special pronunciation

examples.en: he couldn't suppress his contemptuous accent
she had a very clear speech pattern

accentor.definition: small sparrow-like songbird of mountainous regions of Eurasia

accentual.definition:
1) of or pertaining to accent or stress
2) (of verse) having a metric system based on stress rather than syllables or quantity

examples.en: accentual poetry is based on the number of stresses in a line

accentuation.definition: the use or application of an accent; the relative prominence of syllables in a phrase or utterance

accept.definition:
1) consider or hold as true
2) receive willingly something given or offered
3) give an affirmative reply to; respond favorably to

examples.en: I cannot accept the dogma of this church
The only girl who would have him was the miller's daughter
I won't have this dog in my house!

acceptability.definition: satisfactoriness by virtue of conforming to approved standards

acceptable.definition:
1) worthy of acceptance or satisfactory
2) judged to be in conformity with approved usage
4) adequate for the purpose

examples.en: performances varied from acceptable to excellent
the water was acceptable for drinking

acceptably.definition: in an acceptable (but not outstanding) manner

acceptance.definition:
3) the state of being acceptable and accepted
4) (contract law) words signifying consent to the terms of an offer (thereby creating a contract)
5) banking: a time draft drawn on and accepted by a bank

examples.en: torn jeans received no acceptance at the country club
several accepted techniques for treating the condition
his recognized superiority in this kind of work
always more accepting of coaching suggestion than her teammates
the atmosphere was judged to be more supporting and accepting

acceptive.definition:
1) inclined to accept rather than reject
2) accepting willingly

2) to declare or affirm solemnly and formally as true

anticoagulative.definition: of or relating to an anticoagulant

anticonvulsant.definition: a drug used to treat or prevent convulsions (as in epilepsy)

antidiuretic.definition: a drug that limits the formation of urine

antido.definition: an artificial language related to Ido

antidromic.definition: conducting nerve impulses in a direction opposite to normal

antiemetic.definition: a drug that prevents or alleviates nausea and vomiting

antifungal.definition: any agent that destroys or prevents the growth of fungi

antigen.definition: any substance (as a toxin or enzyme) that stimulates an immune response in the body (especially the production of antibodies)

antigua.definition: the largest of the islands comprising Antigua and Barbuda

antiknock.definition: suppressing or eliminating engine knock in combustion engines

antilogarithm.definition: the number of which a given number is the logarithm

antimacassar.definition: a piece of ornamented cloth that protects the back of a chair from hair oils

antimagnetic.definition: impervious to the effects of a magnetic field; resistant to magnetization

antimalarial.definition: a medicinal drug used to prevent or treat malaria

antimatter.definition: matter consisting of elementary particles that are the antiparticles of those making up normal substances

antimetabolite.definition: an antineoplastic drug that inhibits the utilization of a metabolite

antimicrobial.definition: capable of destroying or inhibiting the growth of disease-causing microorganisms

antimony.definition: a metallic element having four allotropic forms; used in a wide variety of alloys; found in stibnite

antimonic.definition: relating to or derived from antimony

antimonopoly.definition: of laws and regulations; designed to protect trade and commerce from unfair business practices

antinode.definition: (physics) the point of maximum displacement in a periodic system

antinomy.definition: a contradiction between two statements that seem equally reasonable

antinomian.definition: relating to or influenced by antinomianism

antioch.definition: a town in southern Turkey; ancient commercial center and capital of Syria; an early center of Christianity

antioxidant.definition: substance that inhibits oxidation or inhibits reactions promoted by oxygen or peroxides

antiparallel.definition: (especially of vectors) parallel but oppositely directed

antiparticle.definition: a particle that has the same mass as another particle but has opposite values for its other properties; interaction of a particle and its antiparticle results in annihilation and the production of radiant energy

antipasto.definition: a course of appetizers in an Italian meal

antipathy.definition:

antipersonnel.definition: designed to inflict death or personal injury rather than material destruction

antiperspirant.definition: an astringent substance applied to the skin to reduce perspiration

antiphon.definition: a verse or song to be chanted or sung in response

antiphonary.definition: relating to or resembling an antiphon or antiphony

antiphony.definition: alternate (responsive) singing by a choir in two parts

antiphrasis.definition: the use of a word in a sense opposite to its normal sense (especially in irony)

antipyresis.definition: medication with antipyretics to treat a fever

antipope.definition: someone who is elected pope in opposition to another person who is held to be canonically elected

antiproton.definition: an unstable negatively charged proton; the antiparticle of a proton

antiprotozoal.definition: a medicinal drug used to fight diseases (like malaria) that are caused by protozoa

antipruritic.definition: a substance that relieves or prevents itching

antiquary.definition: an expert or collector of antiquities

antiquarian.definition:
1) of or relating to persons who study or deal in antiques or antiquities
2) of or relating to antiques or antiquities

antique.definition:

2) out of fashion

examples.en: a suit of rather antique appearance

antiquity.definition:
1) the historic period preceding the Middle Ages in Europe

antirrhinum.definition: a genus of herbs of the family Scrophulariaceae with brightly colored irregular flowers

anti-semite.definition: someone who hates and would persecute Jews

antisepsis.definition: the process of inhibiting the growth and multiplication of microorganisms

antiseptic.definition:
1) thoroughly clean and free of or destructive to disease-causing organisms

antisyphilitic.definition: a drug (or other chemical agent) that is effective against syphilis

antisocial.definition:

antispasmodic.definition: a drug used to relieve or prevent spasms (especially of the smooth muscles)

antistrophe.definition: the section of a choral ode answering a previous strophe in classical Greek drama; the second of two metrically corresponding sections in a poem

antitank.definition: designed for defense against armored vehicles

antithesis.definition:

antithyroid.definition: having the effect of counteracting excessive thyroid activity

antitype.definition:

antitrades.definition: wind in the upper atmosphere blowing above but in the opposite direction from the trade winds

antitussive.definition: any medicine used to suppress or relieve coughing

antivenin.definition: an antitoxin that counteracts the effects of venom from the bite of a snake or insect or other animal

antiviral.definition: inhibiting or stopping the growth and reproduction of viruses

antler.definition: deciduous horn of a member of the deer family

antlia.definition: a faint constellation in the southern hemisphere near Hydra and Vela

antofagasta.definition: a port city on the Pacific in northern Chile

antony.definition: Roman general under Julius Caesar in the Gallic wars; repudiated his wife for the Egyptian queen Cleopatra; they were defeated by Octavian at Actium (83-30 BC)

examples.en: to him the antonym of `gay' was `depressed'

antoninus.definition: Emperor of Rome; nephew and son-in-law and adoptive son of Antonius Pius; Stoic philosopher; the decline of the Roman Empire began under Marcus Aurelius (121-180)

antrorse.definition: bent or curved forward or upward

antrum.definition: a natural cavity or hollow in a bone

examples.en: a constant fretful stamping of hooves

antwerpen.definition: a busy port and financial center in northern Belgium on the Scheldt river; it has long been a center for the diamond industry and the first stock exchange was opened there in 1460

anu.definition: Babylonian god of the sky; one of the supreme triad including Bel and Ea

anubis.definition: Egyptian god of tombs and ruler of the underworld; usually depicted as a man with the head of a jackal

anunnaki.definition: any of a group of powerful Babylonian earth spirits or genii; servitors of the gods

anuretic.definition: of or relating to an inability to urinate

anus.definition: the excretory opening at the end of the alimentary canal

anvil.definition: a heavy block of iron or steel on which hot metals are shaped by hammering

anxiety.definition:
1) (psychiatry) a relatively permanent state of worry and nervousness occurring in a variety of mental disorders, usually accompanied by compulsive behavior or attacks of panic
2) a vague unpleasant emotion that is experienced in anticipation of some (usually ill-defined) misfortune

anxious.definition:
1) eagerly desirous
2) causing or fraught with or showing anxiety
examples: anxious to see the new show at the museum
dying to hear who won
spent an anxious night waiting for the test results
cast anxious glances behind her
those nervous moments before takeoff
an unquiet mind

apathy.definition:
1) an absence of emotion or enthusiasm

examples.en: he spoke apologetically about his past

apologetics.definition: the branch of theology that is concerned with the defense of Christian doctrines

apology.definition:
1) an expression of regret at having caused trouble for someone

1) acknowledge faults or shortcomings or failing

examples.en: He apologized for the many typoes
rationalize the child's seemingly crazy behavior
he rationalized his lack of success

apostasy.definition:

apostrophe.definition:
1) address to an absent or imaginary person
2) the mark (') used to indicate the omission of one or more letters from a printed word

apothegmatic.definition: given to or characterized by terse apothegms

apotropaic.definition: having the power to prevent evil or bad luck

appalachia.definition: an impoverished coal mining area in the Appalachian Mountains (from Pennsylvania to North Carolina)

apparatchik.definition:
1) a humorous but derogatory term for an official of a large organization (especially a political organization)

apparatus.definition:

apparent.definition:

the child is seemingly healthy but the doctor is concerned

apparition.definition:

I was recalled to the present by the apparition of a frightening specter

apparitional.definition: resembling or characteristic of a phantom

examples.en: a ghostly face at the window

appeal.definition:

2) request earnestly (something from somebody); ask for aid or protection
3) (law) a legal proceeding in which the appellant resorts to a higher court for the purpose of obtaining a review of a lower court decision and a reversal of the lower court's judgment or the granting of a new trial

examples.en: He was found guilty but appealed immediately
Invoke God in times of trouble
their appeal was denied in the superior court

appealable.definition: capable of being appealed especially to a higher tribunal

examples.en: decisions...appealable to the head of the agency"- New Republic

appealing.definition: able to attract interest or draw favorable attention

examples.en: He added an appealing and memorable figure to popular American mythology"- Vincent Starrett

appear.definition:
2) come into sight or view
3) be issued or published
4) seem to be true, probable, or apparent

examples.en: He suddenly appeared at the wedding
A new star appeared on the horizon
Did your latest book appear yet?
The new Woody Allen film hasn't come out yet
It seems that he is very gifted
It appears that the weather in California is very bad

appearance.definition:
1) outward or visible aspect of a person or thing
2) the event of coming into sight
3) formal attendance (in court or at a hearing) of a party in an action

appeasement.definition: the act of appeasing (as by acceding to the demands of)

appeaser.definition: someone who tries to bring peace by acceding to demands

examples.en: An appeaser is one who feeds a crocodile--hoping it will eat him last"--Winston Churchill

appeasing.definition: intended to pacify by acceding to demands or granting concessions

examples.en: the appeasing concessions to the Nazis at Munich

appellant.definition: the party who appeals a decision of a lower court

appellate.definition: of or relating to or taking account of appeals (usually legal appeals)

appellation.definition: identifying word or words by which someone or something is called and classified or distinguished from others

appellative.definition:
1) pertaining to or dealing with or used as a common noun
2) inclined to or serving for the giving of names

examples.en: the appellative function of some primitive rites

append.definition:
1) add to the very end
2) fix to; attach

examples.en: He appended a glossary to his novel where he used an invented language
append a charm to the necklace

appendage.definition: a part that is joined to something larger

appendectomy.definition: surgical removal of the vermiform appendix

appendicular.definition: relating to or consisting of an appendage or appendages; especially the limbs

appendicularia.definition: free-swimming tadpole-shaped pelagic tunicate resembling larvae of other tunicates

appendix.definition:

2) a vestigial process that extends from the lower end of the cecum and that resembles a small pouch

apperceive.definition: perceive in terms of a past experience

apperception.definition: the process whereby perceived qualities of an object are related to past experience

apperceptive.definition: able to relate new percepts to past experience

examples.en: a big rich appetent Western city
the object of life is to satisfy as many appetencies as possible"- Granville Hicks

appetizer.definition: food or drink to stimulate the appetite (usually served before a meal or as the first course)

appetizing.definition: appealing to or stimulating the appetite especially in appearance or aroma

applaud.definition:
1) clap one's hands or shout after performances to indicate approval
2) express approval of

examples.en: applaudable efforts to save the environment

applause.definition: a demonstration of approval by clapping the hands together

apple.definition:
1) fruit with red or yellow or green skin and sweet to tart crisp whitish flesh
2) native Eurasian tree widely cultivated in many varieties for its firm rounded edible fruits

applecart.definition:
1) the planning that is disrupted when someone `upsets the applecart'
2) a handcart from which apples and other fruit are sold in the street

applesauce.definition: puree of stewed apples usually sweetened and spiced

meanings.definition: a particular environment or surrounding influence

available.definition:
1) obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service
2) not busy; not otherwise committed
3) convenient for use or disposal

examples.en: much information is available through computers
he was not available for comment
he was available and willing to accompany her
the house is available after July 1
2000 square feet of usable office space

avalanche.definition:
1) gather into a huge mass and roll down a mountain, of snow
2) a sudden appearance of an overwhelming number of things

examples.en: the program brought an avalanche of mail

avalokitesvara.definition: a male Bodhisattva; widely associated with various gods and people

avaram.definition: evergreen Indian shrub with vivid yellow flowers whose bark is used in tanning; sometimes placed in genus Cassia

avarice.definition:
1) reprehensible acquisitiveness; insatiable desire for wealth (personified as one of the deadly sins)
2) extreme greed for material wealth

avaricious.definition: immoderately desirous of acquiring e.g. wealth

examples.en: they are avaricious and will do anything for money
casting covetous eyes on his neighbor's fields

avatar.definition: the manifestation of a Hindu deity (especially Vishnu) in human or superhuman or animal form

examples.en: the Buddha is considered an avatar of the god Vishnu

avenged.definition: for which vengeance has been taken

avens.definition: any of various perennials of the genus Geum having usually pinnate basal leaves and variously colored flowers

avenue.definition:
1) a line of approach
2) a wide street or thoroughfare

examples.en: they explored every avenue they could think of
it promises to open new avenues to understanding

average.definition:
1) approximating the statistical norm or average or expected value
2) lacking special distinction, rank, or status; commonly encountered
3) lacking exceptional quality or ability

examples.en: the average income in New England is below that of the nation
of average height for his age
the ordinary (or common) man in the street
only a fair performance of the sonata

averageness.definition:
1) the state of being that is average; indicates normality but with connotations of mediocrity
2) ordinariness as a consequence of being average and not outstanding

averrhoa.definition: trees native to East Indies having pinnate leaves: carambolas

averroes.definition: Arabian philosopher born in Spain; wrote detailed commentaries on Aristotle that were admired by the Schoolmen (1126-1198)

aversion.definition: the act of turning yourself (or your gaze) away

examples.en: averting her gaze meant that she was angry
They averted their eyes when the King entered

averting.definition: the act of preventing something from occurring

avesta.definition: a collection of Zoroastrian texts gathered during the 4th or 6th centuries

avestan.definition:
1) of or pertaining to the Avesta (sacred text of Zoroastrianism)
2) the script in which the ancient Persian language of the Avesta is written

avian.definition: pertaining to or characteristic of birds

avianize.definition: to modify microorganisms by repeated culture in the developing chick embryo

aviary.definition: a building where birds are kept

aviation.definition:
1) the aggregation of a country's military aircraft
2) the operation of aircraft to provide transportation
3) the art of operating aircraft

avicenna.definition: Arabian physician and influential Islamic philosopher; his interpretation of Aristotle influenced St. Thomas Aquinas; writings on medicine were important for almost 500 years (980-1037)
synonyms: Abu ali al-husain ibn abdallah ibn sina

avicennia.definition: small genus of tropical shrubs or trees

avicenniaceae.definition: used in some classifications: coextensive with the genus Avicennia

avid.definition:
1) (often followed by `for') ardently or excessively desirous
2) marked by active interest and enthusiasm

examples.en: whatever the flavor or color of your local paper, do remember that these are read avidly for local information

avifauna.definition: the birds of a particular region or period

avifaunal.definition: of or relating to birds of a particular region or period

avignon.definition: a town in southeastern France on the Rhone River; the seat of the papacy from 1309 to 1378 and the residence of antipopes during the Great Schism

avionics.definition: science and technology of electronic systems and devices for aeronautics and astronautics

examples.en: avionics has become even more important with the development of the space program

avirulent.definition: not virulent; unable to produce disease

avitaminosis.definition: any of several diseases caused by deficiency of one or more vitamins

avitaminotic.definition: of or relating to or characteristic of avitaminosis

avocado.definition:
1) of the dull yellowish green of the meat of an avocado
2) tropical American tree bearing large pulpy green fruits

avocational.definition: of or involved in an avocation

avocet.definition: long-legged web-footed black-and-white shorebird with slender upward-curving bill

avogadro.definition: Italian physicist noted for his work on gases; proposed what has come to be called Avogadro's law (1776-1856)

avoid.definition:
1) stay clear from; keep away from; keep out of the way of someone or something
3) refrain from doing something
antonyms: He should avoid publishing his wife's memories
Her former friends now avoid her
She refrains from calling her therapist too often
examples: Her former friends now avoid her
She refrains from calling her therapist too often
He should avoid publishing his wife's memories
avoid.brief: stay clear from; keep away from; keep out of the way of someone or something

meanings.definition: stay clear from; keep away from; keep out of the way of someone or something
antonyms: Her former friends now avoid her
examples: Her former friends now avoid her

meanings.definition: refrain from doing something
antonyms: She refrains from calling her therapist too often
He should avoid publishing his wife's memories
examples: She refrains from calling her therapist too often
He should avoid publishing his wife's memories

avoidance.definition: deliberately avoiding; keeping away from or preventing from happening

avoirdupois.definition: a system of weights based on the 16-ounce pound (or 7,000 grains)

avon.definition:
1) a river in southwestern England rising in Gloucestershire and flowing through Bristol to empty into the estuary of the Severn
2) a river in central England that flows through Stratford-on-Avon and empties into the Severn
3) a county in southwestern England

avow.definition: admit openly and bluntly; make no bones about

avowal.definition: a statement asserting the existence or the truth of something

examples.en: her professed love of everything about that country
their policy has been avowedly Marxist
Susan Smith was professedly guilty of the murders

avower.definition: someone who admits or acknowledges openly and boldly

avulsion.definition:
1) an abrupt change in the course of a stream that forms the boundary between two parcels of land resulting in the loss of part of the land of one landowner and a consequent increase in the land of another
2) a forcible tearing or surgical separation of one body part from another

avuncular.definition:
1) resembling a uncle in kindness or indulgence
2) being or relating to an uncle

away.definition:
1) from a particular thing or place or position (`forth' is obsolete)
2) from one's possession
3) (of a baseball pitch) on the far side of home plate from the batter

examples.en: wanted to get away from there
he gave out money to the poor

awayness.definition: the state of being elsewhere than in particular place

awake.definition: not in a state of sleep; completely conscious

examples.en: lay awake thinking about his new job

awaken.definition:
1) cause to become awake or conscious
3) make aware

examples.en: He was roused by the drunken men in the street
They were awakened to the sad facts

awakened.definition:
1) aroused or activated
2) (somewhat formal) having been waked up

examples.en: the awakened baby began to cry
it was the waking up he hated most

award.definition:
1) give, especially as an honor or reward
2) give as judged due or on the basis of merit

examples.en: bestow honors and prizes at graduation
the referee awarded a free kick to the team
the jury awarded a million dollars to the plaintiff

aware.definition: (sometimes followed by `of') having or showing knowledge or understanding or realization or perception

examples.en: was aware of his opponent's hostility

awareness.definition:
1) having knowledge of
2) state of elementary or undifferentiated consciousness

examples.en: he had no awareness of his mistakes
his sudden consciousness of the problem he faced
the crash intruded on his awareness
The famous professor awed the undergraduates

awed.definition:
1) inspired by a feeling of fearful wonderment or reverence
2) having or showing a feeling of mixed reverence and respect and wonder and dread

examples.en: stood in awed silence before the shrine
in grim despair and awestruck wonder

aweigh.definition:
1) (used of an anchor) hanging clear of the bottom
2) (of an anchor) just clear of the bottom

aweless.definition:
1) devoid of any feeling of awe or reverence
2) neither feeling nor showing respect

awful.definition: causing fear or dread or terror

awheel.definition: traveling by wheeled vehicle such as bicycle or automobile e.g.

examples.en: they settled awhile in Virginia before moving West

awkward.definition:
1) causing inconvenience
2) lacking grace or skill in manner or movement or performance
3) difficult to handle or manage especially because of shape

examples.en: they arrived at an awkward time

awkwardness.definition:
1) unskillfulness resulting from a lack of training
2) the quality of an embarrassing situation
3) the carriage of someone whose movements and posture are ungainly or inelegant

examples.en: he sensed the awkwardness of his proposal

awl.definition: a pointed tool for marking surfaces or for punching small holes

awlwort.definition: small aquatic plant having tufted awl-shaped leaves in a basal rosette and minute white flowers; circumboreal

awn.definition: slender bristlelike appendage found on the bracts of grasses

awned.definition: having awns i.e. bristlelike or hairlike appendages on the flowering parts of some cereals and grasses

awning.definition: a canopy made of canvas to shelter people or things from rain or sun

examples.en: with awninged windows on the west side

awnless.definition: lacking or having only very short awns

awol.definition: one who is away or absent without leave

awry.definition: away from the correct or expected course

examples.en: something has gone awry in our plans
something went badly amiss in the preparations

ax.definition:
1) an edge tool with a heavy bladed head mounted across a handle
2) terminate

examples.en: The NSF axed the research program and stopped funding it

axe.definition: chop or split with an ax

axenic.definition:
1) (of experimental animals) raised under sterile conditions
2) (used of cultures of microorganisms) completely free from other organisms

axial.definition:
1) of or relating to or resembling an axis of rotation
3) situated on or along or in the direction of an axis

examples.en: the jet was directed axially toward the cathode

axil.definition: the upper angle between an axis and an offshoot such as a branch or leafstalk

axile.definition: relating to or attached to the axis

axillary.definition:
1) of or relating to the axil
2) of or relating to the armpit

axiology.definition: the study of values and value judgments

axiological.definition: of or relating to the study of values

axiom.definition: (logic) a proposition that is not susceptible of proof or disproof; its truth is assumed to be self-evident

axiomatic.definition:
1) evident without proof or argument
2) containing aphorisms or maxims
3) of or relating to or derived from axioms

examples.en: we hold these truths to be self-evident
the postulational method was applied to geometry"- S.S.Stevens

axis.definition:
1) a straight line through a body or figure that satisfies certain conditions
2) the main stem or central part about which plant organs or plant parts such as branches are arranged
3) in World War II the alliance of Germany and Italy in 1936 which later included Japan and other nations

examples.en: the Axis opposed the Allies in World War II

axle.definition: a shaft on which a wheel rotates

axletree.definition: a dead axle on a carriage or wagon that has terminal spindles on which the wheels revolve

axolotl.definition: larval salamander of mountain lakes of Mexico that usually lives without metamorphosing

axon.definition: long nerve fiber that conducts away from the cell body of the neuron

axonal.definition: of or relating to or resembling an axon

axseed.definition: European herb resembling vetch; naturalized in the eastern United States; having umbels of pink-and-white flowers and sharp-angled pods

azadirachta.definition: genus of large important East Indian trees: neem trees

azalea.definition: any of numerous ornamental shrubs grown for their showy flowers of various colors

azathioprine.definition: an immunosuppressive drug (trade name Imuran) used to prevent rejection of a transplanted organ

azerbaijan.definition: a landlocked republic in southwestern Asia; formerly an Asian soviet

azerbaijani.definition:
1) of or pertaining to Azerbaijan or the people or culture of Azerbaijan
2) the Turkic language spoken by the Azerbaijani

azide.definition: a chemical compound containing the azido group combined with an element or radical

azido.definition: relating to or containing the azido group N3

azygous.definition: occurring singly; not one of a pair

examples.en: the azygous muscle of the uvula

azimuth.definition: the azimuth of a celestial body is the angle between the vertical plane containing it and the plane of the meridian

azimuthal.definition: of or relating to or in azimuth

azo.definition: relating to or containing the azo radical

examples.en: azoic rocks contain not organic remains

azolla.definition: a genus of fern sometimes placed in its own family Azollaceae

azonic.definition: not restricted to any particular zone or region

azores.definition: islands in the Atlantic Ocean belonging to Portugal

examples.en: the Azores are strategically located on transatlantic air and shipping routes

azotemic.definition: of or involving excess nitrogenous waste products in the urine (usually due to kidney insufficiency)

azoturia.definition: excess of urea in the urine

aztec.definition: a member of the Nahuatl people who established an empire in Mexico that was overthrown by Cortes in 1519

aztecan.definition: the Uto-Aztecan language spoken by the Aztec

azure.definition: of a deep somewhat purplish blue color similar to that of a clear October sky

azurite.definition: blue carbonate of copper; blue malachite

a4.definition: A standard paper size of 210 x 297mm

a5.definition: A standard paper size (half A4), 148 x 210mm

aaal.definition: American Academy of Arts and Letters

aarau.definition: A town in Switzerland, capital of Aargau canton

abaco.definition: Two islands (Great Abaco and Little Abaco) in N Bahamas

abacterial.definition: Not caused by or characterized by the presence of bacteria

abaculus.definition: A small tile of glass, marble, or other substance, of various colors, used in making ornamental patterns in mosaic pavements.

abrogative.definition: To abolish, do away with, especially by authority
